meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jessamine Price Vijay Iyer David Gard Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6329.

td.p: Jessamine Price, a graduate student in creative writing from Greenbelt, Maryland
Vijay Iyer, an attorney from New York, New York
David Gard, a retail horticulturist from Jamaica Plain, Massachusetts (whose 4-day cash winnings total $84,700)

tr.td: HALL OF FAMERS
YOU'RE SO RECEPTACLE
TIME TO "ROCK" & "ROLL"
GET YOUR VERBS MOVING
ORGANIZATIONS
SOUTH AFRICAN WILDLIFE
(Kelly: ...from Madikwe Game Reserve. Some of the amazing adaptations that aren't as obvious as claws and speed.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Among the first class of inductees into the Television Hall of Fame were Milton Berle & this zany redhead')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Among the first class of inductees into the Television Hall of Fame were Milton Berle & this zany redhead

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) African elephants deal with more heat than their Asian relatives, so their ears are bigger; when they\'re flapped, thousands of these smallest vessels in the ear bring cool blood to the body')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) African elephants deal with more heat than their Asian relatives, so their ears are bigger; when they're flapped, thousands of these smallest vessels in the ear bring cool blood to the body

If a giraffe didn\'t have adaptations like thick-walled arteries & extra valves to counteract gravity, lowering its head to drink would cause an aneurysm, & then raising its head would cause it to faint, because this vital measure is naturally so high')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) If a giraffe didn't have adaptations like thick-walled arteries & extra valves to counteract gravity, lowering its head to drink would cause an aneurysm, & then raising its head would cause it to faint, because this vital measure is naturally so high

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_4', 'clue_J_6_4_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) Zebras spend a lot of time standing around on grassy plains, which would make them seem like easy prey, but to lions, they blend in with tall stalks of grass, because lions have weak color vision due to a shortage of these retinal cells')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) Zebras spend a lot of time standing around on grassy plains, which would make them seem like easy prey, but to lions, they blend in with tall stalks of grass, because lions have weak color vision due to a shortage of these retinal cells

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew gives the clue from Madiwke Game Reserve in South Africa.) To communicate over distance or in dense brush, rhinos use infrasound, too low for human hearing to detect, because it's below 20 of these frequency units
